intro: Lysimachia arvensis f. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf yellow sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often reddish or purple underneath. The plant produces small, yellow flowers clustered in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a low-growing perennial that thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. This variant is distinguished by its broader foliage compared to the typical form of Lysimachia arvensis.
